articles.title: Kim Jong Un Has Photo Session with Officials, Working People Who Contributed to Completion of Power Station
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Has Photo Session with Officials, Working People Who Contributed to Completion of Power Station
 Pyongyang, October 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, had a photo session with the officials and working people of the relevant units who made contributions to completing the Paektusan Hero Youth Power Station.
					 When he arrived at the photographing venue, all the participants presented the warmest thanks to him.
					
					 He warmly acknowledged the enthusiastic cheer of the participants.
					
					 He warmly congratulated the officials and working people of the relevant units who made great contributions to successfully completing the power station and had a photo session with them.
					
					 He expressed the belief that all the participants would uphold the Workers' Party of Korea with the brilliant successes in building an economic power in the future, too, by inheriting the proud tradition of the Korean working class.
					
					 Present at the photo session were Ro Tu Chol, vice-premier of the Cabinet and chairman of the State Planning Commission, Kim Yong Ho, secretary general of the Cabinet, Ri Jong Guk, minister of Machine-building Industry, Kim Yong Gwang, minister of Metallurgical Industry, Kang Jong Gwan, minister of Land and Maritime Transport, and Jang Hyok, minister of Railways.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Birthday Spread to Korean in Russia Jong Il Sim
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Birthday Spread to Korean in Russia Jong Il Sim 
						
 Pyongyang, October 26 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un sent a gift and birthday spread to Jong Il Sim, Korean in Russia in the socialist motherland on her 90th birthday. 
					 The gift and birthday spread reflects his love to take warm care of DPRK Hero An Tong Su and his bereaved families, setting store by the ennobling sense of obligation shown by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il towards them. 
					
					 The gift and birthday spread were conveyed to Jong Il Sim on Monday.

articles.title: 16th National Software Exhibition of Educational Institutions Opens
articles.content:
16th National Software Exhibition of Educational Institutions Opens 
						
 Pyongyang, October 26 (KCNA) -- The 16th National Software Exhibition of Education Institutions opened with due ceremony at the Three-Revolution Exhibition House Monday. 
					 On exhibit are more than 500 programs developed by teachers, researchers and students of over 70 educational institutions across the country including Kim Il Sung University and Kim Chaek University of Technology. 
					
					 The exhibition will be divided into 17 display panels and two contest panels. 
					
					 The exhibition will offer a good opportunity for introducing and exchanging the successes and experience gained in developing programs conducive to putting education on a modern and IT basis, building an economic power and improving people's living standard. 
					
					 Present at the opening ceremony were officials concerned, teachers, researchers and students who presented programs. 
					
					 At the end of the ceremony the participants looked around the exhibition hall.

articles.title: Lao Delegation Arrives
articles.content:
Lao Delegation Arrives
 Pyongyang, October 26 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Ministry of Public Security of Laos led by Minister Somkeo Sylavong arrived here Monday.
					 The Ministry of People's Security of the DPRK gave a reception in honor of the delegation at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on the same day.

articles.title: German Delegation Leaves
articles.content:
German Delegation Leaves
						
 Pyongyang, October 26 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the German-Korean Parliamentary Friendship Group led by Chairman Hartmut Koschyk left here for home on Monday.

articles.title: Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
						
 Pyongyang, October 26 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Ministry of Public Security of Laos visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill Monday.
					 They laid bunches of flowers before their statues and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: UN Resident Coordinator in DPRK Hosts Reception
articles.content:
UN Resident Coordinator in DPRK Hosts Reception 
						
 Pyongyang, October 26 (KCNA) -- Tapan Mishra, UN Resident Coordinator and UNDP Resident Representative in the DPRK, gave a reception at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Club on Monday on the Day of the United Nations. 
					 Present there on invitation were Pak Myong Guk, vice-foreign minister, officials concerned and foreign diplomatic envoys here. 
					
					 Representatives of the international organizations here were present at the reception.

articles.title: Vietnamese Embassy Officials Do Friendship Labor at Migok Cooperative Farm
articles.content:
Vietnamese Embassy Officials Do Friendship Labor at Migok Cooperative Farm
						
 Sariwon, October 26 (KCNA) -- Ambassador Pham Viet Hung and staff members of the Vietnamese embassy here did friendship labor at the DPRK-Vietnam Friendship Migok Cooperative Farm in Sariwon City on Monday.
					 The guests visited the Migok Revolutionary Museum. Being briefed on the leadership feats President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il performed for the farm, they went round historical relics.
					
					 They helped farmers in rice threshing.
					
					 They handed aid materials over to the farm.

articles.title: Photo Exhibition Marking National Day of Czech Republic Opens
articles.content:
Photo Exhibition Marking National Day of Czech Republic Opens 
						
 Pyongyang, October 26 (KCNA) -- A photo exhibition opened with due ceremony at the Chollima Hall of Culture Monday under the joint name of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, the Czech embassy here and the Korea-Czech Friendship Association to mark the 97th national day of the Czech Republic. 
					 Present at the opening ceremony were Chairman of the Korea-Czech Friendship Association Ryu Kyong Il, officials concerned, Pyongyangites, Czech Ambassador to the DPRK Milan Hupceij and his embassy officials. 
					
					 Foreign embassy officials here were present on invitation. 
					
					 Speeches were made. 
					
					 The participants looked round the photos on display.

articles.title: Reunion of Separated Families and Relatives from North and South Closes
articles.content:
Reunion of Separated Families and Relatives from North and South Closes 
						
 Mt. Kumgang Resort, October 26 (KCNA) -- The reunion of separated families and relatives from the north and the south came to a close. The reunion started from Oct. 20 at Mt. Kumgang Resort.
					 The separated families and relatives from the north and the south inquired after the health of their families and relatives.
					
					 The separated families and relatives from the north told those from the south about the happy and worthwhile life they are leading under the care of the socialist motherland.
					
					 The C.C., the DPRK Red Cross Society gave a reception in honor of separated families and relatives from the north and the south on Oct. 24.
					
					 Those from the north and the south bid farewell to one another on Monday, hoping to have reunion again.

articles.title: Combined Service Boat Mujigae
articles.content:
Combined Service Boat Mujigae
 Pyongyang, October 26 (KCNA) -- The combined service boat Mujigae began service on the River Taedong, cruising between Okryu and Taedong bridges in Pyongyang.
					 The four-storied boat, with a total floor space of 11 390 square meters, has a displacement of 3 500 tons and can accommodate over 1 230 guests.
					
					 It has such service facilities as national food, deck and revolving restaurants and coffee, soft drink, party and buffet rooms, shop, etc.
					
					 Ri Son Sil, deputy manager of the boat, said the boat is crowded with guests in the evenings.
					
					 Supreme leader Kim Jong Un personally named the boat Mujigae.
					
					 When going round the boat some days ago, he said that he felt the greatest pleasure when having provided one more treasure to the people like it.

articles.title: DPRK Strives to Increase Marine Products
articles.content:
DPRK Strives to Increase Marine Products
						
 Pyongyang, October 26 (KCNA) -- Fishery stations in the DPRK are conducting various works to increase the turnout of marine products.
					 Those stations in the east and west coastal areas of the country have concentrated efforts on careful preparations for winter fishing while pushing ahead with ship building or repairing and introducing a new satellite-based system of searching fishing grounds.
					
					 They also work hard to develop the net fish farming in the sea.
					
					 Meanwhile, various projects are progressing apace to increase the production of various kinds of seaweeds.

articles.title: New Clinical Method of Heart Surgery Developed
articles.content:
New Clinical Method of Heart Surgery Developed
						
 Pyongyang, October 26 (KCNA) -- The Okryu Children's Hospital in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea has developed a new clinical method of heart surgery.
					 The method is considered to help prevent complications and cut short treatment days.
					
					 It also helps drastically raise recovery rate.
					
					 The new method was registered as one of the national scientific and technological successes.

articles.title: North-South Contacts and Visits Are Expression of Strong Will of DPRK: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
North-South Contacts and Visits Are Expression of Strong Will of DPRK: Rodong Sinmun
						
 Pyongyang, October 26 (KCNA) -- The reunion of separated families and relatives took place at Mt. Kumgang Resort and a football match of workers of the north and the south for reunification will be held in Pyongyang a few days later, says an article of Rodong Sinmun Monday.
					 This is a fruition brought about by the sincere efforts made by the DPRK for the implementation of the north-south agreement in the wake of the high-level urgent contact and its warm patriotism and the firm will of the DPRK to give momentum to the atmosphere of improving the relations through dialogue and cooperation in the spirit of By Our Nation Itself, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 Independent reunification and prosperity common to the nation would be unthinkable without dialogue, cooperation, reconciliation and unity of the north and the south.
					
					 The fundamental purpose of improving the north-south relations is to independently solve the issue of the destiny of the nation.
					
					 In order to improve the north-south relations, it is necessary to wipe out misunderstanding and mistrust, respect and trust the dialogue partner and get reconciled and seek cooperation on the basis of common points while shelving differences.
					
					 The fundamental stand and attitude to be maintained for improving the north-south relations are the spirit of By Our Nation Itself.
					
					 The June 15 era of reunification had already proved what an excellent product was brought about by the north-south dialogue and cooperation in the spirit of By Our Nation Itself.
					
					 Useless are dialogue and contacts pursuing confrontation of social systems while shunning the desire of the fellow countrymen and the requirements of the times.
					
					 The north-south relations can never be improved as long as the south Korean authorities pursue "unification of social systems" with the backing of outsiders.
					
					 Invariable is the principled stand of the DPRK to pursue reconciliation, unity and cooperation from the stand of By Our Nation Itself by putting the interests common to the nation above all.

articles.title: Conclusion of Peace Treaty Is Prerequisite to Solving Korean Peninsula Issue: KCNA Commentary
articles.content:
Conclusion of Peace Treaty Is Prerequisite to Solving Korean Peninsula Issue: KCNA Commentary 
						
 Pyongyang, October 26 (KCNA) -- The statement of the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK which clarified the principled stand of the DPRK to replace the Korean Armistice Agreement with a peace treaty is evoking a lively response in the world.
					 Reuters, AFP and a radio broadcasting service of France, Vietnamese newspapers Nhan Dan and Quan Doi Nhan Dan and other media of many countries are reporting the statement every day under the titles "North Korea rejects dialogue proposed by U.S. and south Korea on condition of nuclear dismantlement, asserts conclusion of a peace treaty" and "DPRK Foreign Ministry in a statement urges the U.S. to come out for conclusion of a peace treaty".
					
					 This is a vivid expression of the active support and solidarity by the world peace-loving people with the fair and aboveboard proposal of the DPRK to remove the danger of a war and create a peaceful environment on the Korean Peninsula by concluding a peace treaty between the DPRK and the U.S. at an early date. 
					
					 The DPRK has consistently called for replacing the AA with a peace treaty, considering the present AA would not help hold off armed conflict and the outbreak of a new war. 
					
					 The DPRK recently re-clarified the above-said stand on the basis of a serious lesson it had drawn from the situation which prevailed on the peninsula in last August.
					
					 A minor accidental case pushed the situation to the brink of a war. This finally proved that the present AA would never check conflict and war and that what is a prerequisite to ensuring environment for lasting peace on the peninsula is to conclude a peace treaty between the DPRK and the U.S. 
					
					 The conclusion of the peace treaty presents itself as a top priority task for settling the Korean issue also because long-standing efforts for dialogue for the denuclearization of the peninsula ended without success.
					
					 Taking into consideration the stand of the parties concerned for discussing the denuclearization issue before anything else in the past, the DPRK took part in the negotiations for handling the denuclearization at the six-party talks first and also discussed the nuclear issue and the issue of ensuring peace at the same time. But all efforts proved futile and even though partial agreements were reached, they were not put into practice.
					
					 The U.S. is persistently pursuing its hostile policy toward the DPRK, escalating the tension on the peninsula through ever more undisguised military provocations.
					
					 Even at this time when the DPRK clarified its stand for concluding a peace treaty, the U.S. staged large-scale combined naval exercises with the south Korean navy by bringing nuclear carrier Ronald Reagan, cruisers and Aegis destroyers to the waters off Pusan. 
					
					 Despite its persistent nuclear blackmail and nuclear war exercises against the DPRK, the U.S. urges the DPRK to come out to a negotiating table after scrapping its nuclear program, claiming the denuclearization is a priority. This is a brigandish logic and sophism that can be let loose by aggressors only.
					
					 The U.S. is now standing against the conclusion of a peace treaty and increasing the tension on the peninsula, prompted by its hegemonic ambition for the region.
					
					 The U.S. undisguised hostile policy toward the DPRK, ceaseless large-scale joint military exercises and the introduction of nuclear strike means into south Korea are causing an evil cycle of confrontation and escalation of tension on the peninsula. This is sparking off arms race and ratcheting up tension in the Asia-Pacific region.
					
					 Andrei Ivanov, expert of Moscow State International Relations' University of Russia, when interviewed by media said: All rackets targeting Pyongyang are pursuant to the U.S. aim to boost military muscle in the Asia-Pacific and build a missile shield with the nuclear threat from North Korea as a pretext. What matters is not Pyongyang but Washington's ambition targeting Beijing and Moscow.
					
					 This is by no means accidental. 
					
					 All this proves that the denuclearization of the peninsula touted by the U.S. is nothing but an empty talk just as it was before and that the conclusion of a peace treaty between the DPRK and the U.S. is the wisest solution to the issue.
					
					 Unless a priority is given to the conclusion of a peace treaty with the U.S., chief criminal responsible for the escalation of tension on the peninsula, it would be impossible to ensure genuine and lasting peace on the peninsula nor would it be possible to solve any other issues of interest of the countries concerned including the U.S.
					
					 The U.S. should no longer resort to the racket of "nuclear dismantlement of the north" and nuclear confrontation but seriously respond to the crucial proposal for replacing the AA with a peace treaty at an early date.

articles.title: S. Korean Organizations Call for Halt to Moves for Distorting Historic Textbooks
articles.content:
S. Korean Organizations Call for Halt to Moves for Distorting Historic Textbooks
 Pyongyang, October 26 (KCNA) -- The Council for the Peaceful Unification of Tangun's Nation and other organizations in south Korea held a joint press conference in Seoul on Oct. 22 in protest against the "state-compiled history textbooks" outside the building of the "government".
					 More than 120 organizations issued a joint statement.
					
					 The present regime and the ruling forces are promoting the edition of the "state-compiled history textbooks", the statement noted, opposing the serious distortion of history and ideological dispute caused by it.

articles.title: S. Korean Chief Executive Ridiculed
articles.content:
S. Korean Chief Executive Ridiculed 
						
 Pyongyang, October 26 (KCNA) -- A caricature of the south Korean chief executive wearing sun glasses appeared in a street of Seoul, according the south Korean CBS. 
					 It bore letters "slave education" and "slave labor". 
					
					 Last year, too, satirical leaflets ridiculing the chief executive pursuing an unpopular rule, fascist rule, sycophantic diplomacy and confrontation with the fellow countrymen in the north and demanding her resignation were scattered in all parts of south Korea on the occasion of the second year of her seizure of power, making the south Korean conservative group tremble with fear.

articles.title: S. Korean Paper Denounces Chief Executive for Her Wrong Attitude towards Issue of History Textbooks
articles.content:
S. Korean Paper Denounces Chief Executive for Her Wrong Attitude towards Issue of History Textbooks 
 Pyongyang, October 26 (KCNA) -- The south Korean paper Kyunghyang Daily News on October 23 carried an editorial denouncing the south Korean chief executive for her wrong attitude towards the issue of history textbooks. 
					 The editorial accused the chief executive of not making even a step back over the issue of the "state-compiled history textbooks". 
					
					 Her attitude defying stronger public denunciation makes people suspect her personal ambition for "restoring the honor" of her father, the editorial said.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Benin
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Benin
						
 Pyongyang, October 26 (KCNA) -- A committee of the Socialist Party of Benin for remembering Generalissimo Kim Jong Il was inaugurated in Cotonou on Oct. 20.
					 Ali Houdou, president of the party, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to significantly organize political and cultural events for giving wide publicity to the sacred revolutionary career and undying feats of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: WPK's 70th Birthday Observed by Foreign Newspapers
articles.content:
WPK's 70th Birthday Observed by Foreign Newspapers
						
 Pyongyang, October 26 (KCNA) -- Foreign newspapers dedicated special write-ups to the 70th founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 The Oct. 6th issue of the Zimbabwean newspaper Herald carried an article titled "Congratulations on the 70th founding anniversary of the WPK" illustrated with a photo of supreme leader Kim Jong Un making a speech.
					
					 The article said: 
					
					 The WPK is guided by Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism.
					
					 As a result, it has grown strong to be an ideological pure entity fully equipped with the Juche idea and Songun idea and demonstrated its might as a powerful party which has consistently adhered to the revolutionary principle despite all tests of history.
					
					 This is one of the important factors that enabled the WPK to invariably hold high the banner of socialism without any slightest vacillation and deviation despite the imperialist allied forces' vicious moves to isolate and stifle the DPRK in the closing years of the last century.
					
					 The Oct. 25th issue of DR Congolese newspaper L'Avenir said in its article titled "The WPK and building of a thriving nation" illustrated with a photo of Kim Jong Un standing on the tribune of honor of Kim Il Sung Square that the Korean people are more dynamically pushing forward the building of a thriving nation full of faith in victory under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The Thai Xing San Daily carried an article titled "70 years of leading the people" accompanied with a photo of smiling President Kim Il Sung on Oct. 10.
					
					 Saying that the WPK has always led the Korean people to victories, weathering all sorts of difficulties and trials for 70 years since its founding, the paper stressed that the WPK would only demonstrate victory and glory in the future, too.

articles.title: Austrian Organizations Urge U.S. to Respond to Proposal for Concluding Peace Treaty with DPRK
articles.content:
Austrian Organizations Urge U.S. to Respond to Proposal for Concluding Peace Treaty with DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, October 26 (KCNA) -- Austrian organizations made public statements in support of the statement issued by the DPRK Foreign Ministry on Oct. 21.
					 The Group of Youth for the Study of Kim Jong Il Juche Idea in Vienna said in its statement:
					
					 We fully support the statement of the DPRK Foreign Ministry.
					
					 We urge the U.S. to immediately roll back its hostile policy toward the DPRK and respond to the proposal for concluding a peace treaty.
					
					 The conclusion of the peace treaty between the DPRK and the U.S. is an important guarantee for ensuring peace on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 The Solidarity Committee of Unionists for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea in Austria said:
					
					 The threat to peace on the Korean peninsula and the rest of the world increasing due to the war exercises against the DPRK being staged by the U.S. forces present in south Korea should be defused without fail.
					
					 The U.S. should halt its ceaseless war drills against the DPRK at once and sincerely meet the demands of the DPRK.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Speech Introduced by British Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Speech Introduced by British Organization 
						
 Pyongyang, October 26 (KCNA) -- The full text of a speech made by supreme leader Kim Jong Un at a military parade and public procession of Pyongyangites for celebrating the 70th founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea was posted by the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy on its website on Oct. 21.
					 The speech made on Oct. 10, Juche 104 (2015) said that the history of the WPK precisely means the path covered by the Korean people, its might their might, its greatness their greatness, and its victory the victory won by them.
					
					 It also indicates the tasks facing the WPK to fulfill its heavy yet sacred mission as a motherly party that has invariably worked for the people with affection in the future, too.
					
					 A photo of Kim Jong Un was posted on the website.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un se fotografia con  contribuidores a construccion de Central Hidraulica
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un se fotografia con  contribuidores a construccion de Central Hidraulica
						
Pyongyang, 26 de octubre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, se fotografio junto con los funcionarios de las unidades relacionadas y los trabajadores, quienes contribuyeron al termino de la Central Hidroelectrica Jovenes Heroes Paektusan.
					Al Mariscal quien llego al lugar de filmacion todos los participantes le dieron el mas cordial saludo de agradecimiento.
					
					El Mariscal respondio cordialmente a las efusivas aclamaciones de los participantes.
					
					Felicito calurosamente a los funcionarios de las unidades relacionadas y los trabajadores, quienes hicieron gran aporte a la edificacion de la Central Hidraulica y se fotografio junto con ellos.
					
					Expreso la conviccion de que en el futuro tambien todos los participantes apoyaran al partido con brillantes exitos en la construccion de una potencia economica continuando la gloriosa tradicion de la clase obrera coreana.
					
					En la filiacion participaron Ro Tu Chol, vicepremier y presidente del Comite Estatal de Planificacion, Kim Yong Ho, secretario general del Consejo de Ministros,  Ri Jong Guk, ministro de Industria Mecanica, Kim Yong Gwang, ministro de Industria Metalurgica, Kang Jong Gwan, ministro de Transporte Terrestre y Maritimo, y Jang Hyok, ministro del Ferrocarril.

articles.title: CRPP denuncia la provocacion militar del Sur de Corea en Mar Oeste de Corea
articles.content:
CRPP denuncia la provocacion militar del Sur de Corea en Mar Oeste de Corea
						
Pyongyang, 26 de octubre (ACNC) -- A la pregunta de la ACNC formulada en relacion con que los belicistas de la capa militar del Sur de Corea perpetraron en el Mar Oeste de Corea una grave provocacion contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, el portavoz del Comite por la Reunificacion Pacifica de la Patria dio el dia 25 la siguiente respuesta:
					El pasado dia 24, bajo el pretexto del "acercamiento a la linea de limite al Norte" y la "advertencia", los belicistas surcoreanos dispararon arbitrariamente contra el barco patrullero del Ejercito Popular de Corea, que estaba de guardia ordinaria en la zona maritima de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					
					El presente canonazo perpetrado a plena luz del dia resulta  una provocacion premeditada para volver a agravar la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana causando el conflicto armado en las candentes aguas del Mar Oeste de Corea.
					
					Lo mas problematico es que el presente caso coincidio en tiempo con los hechos de que el jefe de la Junta de Jefes de Estado Mayor y otros caudillos de la capa militar del Sur de Corea hablan del "castigo severo" y de "represalia de reflejo condicionado" dando vueltas por la isla Yonphyong y otras zonas de la linea avanzada del frente y se desarrollan los freneticos ejercicios de guerra de agresion contra la RPDC tales como los ejercicios maritimos combinados y el simulacro Hoguk introduciendo hasta el portaaviones nuclear de Estados Unidos.
					
					Gracias a los esfuerzos iniciativos y sinceros de la RPDC, se efectua en el monte Kumgang el encuentro de los familiares y parientes separados en medio de la gran esperanza y atencion del interior y exterior del pais.
					
					Viendo a las personas que comparten el amor fraternal al cabo de varios decenios, todos los coreanos sienten de todo corazon la inminencia de la reunificacion de la patria y esperan que este clima de reconciliacion logre buen resultado.
					
					La presente provocacion militar de los gangsteres militares surcoreanos partio del malsano intento de romper el ambiente de la mejora de relaciones intercoreanas preparado dificilmente e impedir la ejecucion del Acuerdo Norte-Sur.
					
					Al mismo tiempo, demuestra claramente quien es el provocador que perturba la paz de la Peninsula Coreana y exacerba la tension y quien es el autor de la destruccion de las relaciones N-S.
					
					Mientras que los gangsteres militares surcoreanos actuen con imprudencia nadando a contrapelo de la aspiracion y anhelo de la nacion coreana a la reunificacion, no se mejoraran los vinculos Norte-Sur sino se acarrearan los desastres de la guerra.
					
					Aunque apreciamos la paz, no perdonaremos nunca, sino castigaremos implacablemente a los provocadores enloquecidos en la confrontacion y la guerra.
					
					Si los belicistas surcoreanos siguen recurriendo a la imprudente locura militar sin abandonar el vicio de perseguir la confrontacion fratricida inventando los incidentes sensacionales, se ocasionara un conflicto armado imprevisible y las relaciones entre ambas partes coreanas volveran al extremo creado antes del Acuerdo de agosto.
					
					La responsabilidad por el respecto recaera enteramente sobre las autoridades surcoreanas. 
					
					Los belicistas del Sur de Corea deben actuar con prudencia teniendo en clara cuenta que no hay nada que obtener con la provocacion militar contra los connacionales.

articles.title: Inaugurada XVI exposicion nacional de programas de sector docente
articles.content:
Inaugurada XVI exposicion nacional de programas de sector docente
						
Pyongyang, 26 de octubre (ACNC) -- Quedo inaugurada la XVI exposicion nacional de programas de la rama de ensenanza.
					En la ocasion se presentaron mas de 500 programas disenados por los profesores, investigadores y estudiantes de mas de 70 unidades de la rama docente de todo el pais incluidas la Universidad Kim Il Sung y la Politecnica Kim Chaek.
					
					En la presente cita, que se efectua dividida en 17 secciones de exhibicion y en las dos secciones de concurso, se intercambiaran los exitos y experiencias alcanzados por las universidades y escuelas de diversas localidades en el curso de desarrollar los programas capaces de modernizar y informatizar la educacion y contribuir a la mejora de las condiciones de vida del pueblo.
					
					La ceremonia de inauguracion tuvo lugar el dia 26 en la Exposicion Permanente de las Tres Revoluciones con la participacion de los funcionarios correspondientes, profesores, investigadores y estudiantes quienes presentaron programas.
					
					Terminada la ceremonia, los participantes recorrieron la galeria.

articles.title: Coordinador permanente de ONU en RPDC ofrece banquete por Dia de ONU
articles.content:
Coordinador permanente de ONU en RPDC ofrece banquete por Dia de ONU
						
Pyongyang, 26 de octubre (ACNC) -- Tapan Mishra, coordinador permanente de la ONU y representante permanente del Programa de las Naciones Unidas para el Desarrollo, acreditado en la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, ofrecio el dia 26 en el Club para el Cuerpo Diplomatico Taedonggang un banquete dedicado al Dia de la ONU.
					En la ocasion fueron invitados Pak Myong Guk, viceministro de Relaciones Exteriores y otros funcionarios coreanos, asi como los representantes diplomaticos de varios paises en la RPDC.
					
					Asistieron alli los representantes de las organizaciones internacionales en Corea.
